intro: Chloopsis caulescens, commonly known as the slender chloopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soils and low water availability. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in xerophytic gardens.
